summary: REQ-1 is implemented by updating the exported APP_VERSION string to "Version 22". There is no clear evidence in the provided diff summary of the actual production Internet Computer deployment work required by REQ-2 (e.g., deployment config/scripts, canister settings, or release steps), nor evidence that the backend upgrade/init path was specifically handled for a live upgrade.

missing_requirements.requirement: Deploy Version 22 to the live Internet Computer canister(s) so end users receive this release when loading the production URL.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows code/config edits (notably frontend version constant and HTML cache headers), but no explicit deployment-related changes (e.g., dfx deploy configuration, canister IDs, CI/CD pipeline updates, or release scripts) that would demonstrate production canister deployment and upgrade behavior.

hallucinated_features.description: Large backend logic changes related to Nakshatra computation, access control initialization, and new/expanded types and storage maps.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest is strictly about making Version 22 live and updating the displayed version label; it explicitly lists non-goals of implementing new product features or unrelated refactors. The backend changes shown appear feature-level and not tied to the version label/deployment requirements in the request.

hallucinated_features.description: Added aggressive no-cache meta tags to the frontend HTML document.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not explicitly requested by REQ-1/REQ-2. While it may be intended to help with caching/hard-refresh issues, the BuildRequest did not ask to change HTML caching behavior.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated/introduced project tracking entries for AR-1/AR-2/AR-3 in project_state.json.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by the BuildRequest requirements or acceptance criteria; appears to be internal bookkeeping unrelated to deploying Version 22 or updating the visible version label.
